tweets.text:
We spoke to @EnvAgency Chair @EmmaHowardBoyd about the simple steps you can take to protect yourself from flooding.

Sign up for flood alerts here: https://t.co/KuIjpLKutU https://t.co/YKXL8pGzxf

Meanwhile 20mm of rain over south #herefordshire has caused this.

#soilpatrol has been out today and this farmer will be receiving a visit. https://t.co/abaUme57we

3 SEVERE Flood Warnings remain on the River Dee this morning. 195 Flood Warnings across the rest of England and Wales @EnvAgency @NatResWales 

The flood risk will continue into the weekend, even though the worst of the rain is over. Latest flood warnings: https://t.co/XiHiA8b3KB https://t.co/0lMcnGmDAQ

Looks like a whole new level of engineering this time to keep the Ouse off Tower Street.. all looking very proficient.. hearing it was a v close run thing for homes in Tower Place this timeüíêüíêwell done @cityofyork @EnvAgencyYNE /1 https://t.co/A2oeT2RTZQ

Here's a write up of what the Environ Sec said - very much keen to stress that this was an exceptional event & funding reform is being 'considered'
https://t.co/YRcPawDKOF

Green Party Councillor @paulthoro9ood opposes planned quarry at Coggeshall - "damage caused to Coggeshall and its community by this quarry is out of all proportion": Please let common sense prevail over quarry bid https://t.co/7uENPf4rNO

urls.title: LETTER: Please let common sense prevail over quarry bid
urls.description: Disastrous plans for a huge quarry on the outskirts of Coggeshall are expected to be submitted this month to Essex County Council.

tweets.text: Say No to this quarry on the edge of Coggeshall.  Virtually no one wants it and it will do great damage to the environment and heritage whereas there are other natural flood management schemes.  This is a sledgehammer to crack a nut and effectively buying planning permission
@sarah_dentonn @nenescape @EnvAgencyAnglia There are no litter bins. Maybe @CostaCoffee would like to contribute?! üòä

tweets.text: Often after #UKfloods, people say 'rivers need to be cleared'. Actually, no, rivers *need* obstructions to hold back water and #slowtheflow to reduce #flooding downstream. urls.title: The Prime Minister visits Didsbury following Storm Christoph
urls.description: This week, Storm Christoph brought heavy rain to very wet ground and full rivers. Today, I joined the Prime Minister who visited Didsbury in Greater Manchester where properties were evacuated. When we arrived the channel leading to the flood storage ‚Ä¶
